Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Presentation.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class serves as the mediator between the user interface (View) and the business logic layer (BLL). It handles initializing data, setting up action listeners, and managing business processes related to clients, products, and orders.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Bud Vasile-Stefan

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller(View view)
      Constructor for the Controller class. Initializes the view and business logic layers, sets up initial data and action listeners.
      Parameters:
      view - The main view of the application

  • Method Details

    • initializeData

      public void initializeData()
      Initializes the application data by updating all tables and combo boxes.

    • addActionListeners

      public void addActionListeners()
      Sets up action listeners for all buttons in the application. Maps user interface actions to their corresponding handler methods.

    • updateLogTable

      public void updateLogTable()
      Updates the bill log table with current data from the database.

    • updateClientTable

      public void updateClientTable()
      Updates the client table with current data from the database.

    • addClient

      public void addClient()
      Handles adding a new client to the system. Validates and saves client data, then updates relevant UI components.

    • editClient

      public void editClient()
      Handles editing an existing client's information. Updates client data and refreshes relevant UI components.

    • deleteClient

      public void deleteClient()
      Handles deleting a selected client from the system. Shows confirmation dialog before deletion and updates UI accordingly.

    • updateProductTable

      public void updateProductTable()
      Updates the product table with current data from the database.

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct()
      Handles adding a new product to the system. Validates and saves product data, then updates relevant UI components.

    • editProduct

      public void editProduct()
      Handles editing an existing product's information. Updates product data and refreshes relevant UI components.

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct()
      Handles deleting a selected product from the system. Shows a confirmation dialog before deletion and updates UI accordingly.

    • updateOrderCombos

      public void updateOrderCombos()
      Updates the client and product combo boxes with current data.

    • updateOrdersTable

      public void updateOrdersTable()
      Updates the orders table with current data from the database.

    • createOrder

      public void createOrder()
      Handles creating a new order in the system. Validates order data, checks stock availability, creates order, and generates a bill.
